00068 /*
00069  * (new) readdir implementation overview.
00070  *
00071  * Original lustre readdir implementation cached exact copy of raw directory
00072  * pages on the client. These pages were indexed in client page cache by
00073  * logical offset in the directory file. This design, while very simple and
00074  * intuitive had some inherent problems:
00075  *
00076  *     . it implies that byte offset to the directory entry serves as a
00077  *     telldir(3)/seekdir(3) cookie, but that offset is not stable: in
00078  *     ext3/htree directory entries may move due to splits, and more
00079  *     importantly,
00080  *
00081  *     . it is incompatible with the design of split directories for cmd3,
00082  *     that assumes that names are distributed across nodes based on their
00083  *     hash, and so readdir should be done in hash order.
00084  *
00085  * New readdir implementation does readdir in hash order, and uses hash of a
00086  * file name as a telldir/seekdir cookie. This led to number of complications:
00087  *
00088  *     . hash is not unique, so it cannot be used to index cached directory
00089  *     pages on the client (note, that it requires a whole pageful of hash
00090  *     collided entries to cause two pages to have identical hashes);
00091  *
00092  *     . hash is not unique, so it cannot, strictly speaking, be used as an
00093  *     entry cookie. ext3/htree has the same problem and lustre implementation
00094  *     mimics their solution: seekdir(hash) positions directory at the first
00095  *     entry with the given hash.
00096  *
00097  * Client side.
00098  *
00099  * 0. caching
00100  *
00101  * Client caches directory pages using hash of the first entry as an index. As
00102  * noted above hash is not unique, so this solution doesn't work as is:
00103  * special processing is needed for "page hash chains" (i.e., sequences of
00104  * pages filled with entries all having the same hash value).
00105  *
00106  * First, such chains have to be detected. To this end, server returns to the
00107  * client the hash of the first entry on the page next to one returned. When
00108  * client detects that this hash is the same as hash of the first entry on the
00109  * returned page, page hash collision has to be handled. Pages in the
00110  * hash chain, except first one, are termed "overflow pages".
00111  *
00112  * Solution to index uniqueness problem is to not cache overflow
00113  * pages. Instead, when page hash collision is detected, all overflow pages
00114  * from emerging chain are immediately requested from the server and placed in
00115  * a special data structure (struct ll_dir_chain). This data structure is used
00116  * by ll_readdir() to process entries from overflow pages. When readdir
00117  * invocation finishes, overflow pages are discarded. If page hash collision
00118  * chain weren't completely processed, next call to readdir will again detect
00119  * page hash collision, again read overflow pages in, process next portion of
00120  * entries and again discard the pages. This is not as wasteful as it looks,
00121  * because, given reasonable hash, page hash collisions are extremely rare.
00122  *
00123  * 1. directory positioning
00124  *
00125  * When seekdir(hash) is called, original
00126  *
00127  *
00128  *
00129  *
00130  *
00131  *
00132  *
00133  *
00134  * Server.
00135  *
00136  * identification of and access to overflow pages
00137  *
00138  * page format
00139  *
00140  * Page in MDS_READPAGE RPC is packed in LU_PAGE_SIZE, and each page contains
00141  * a header lu_dirpage which describes the start/end hash, and whether this
00142  * page is empty (contains no dir entry) or hash collide with next page.
00143  * After client receives reply, several pages will be integrated into dir page
00144  * in PAGE_CACHE_SIZE (if PAGE_CACHE_SIZE greater than LU_PAGE_SIZE), and the
00145  * lu_dirpage for this integrated page will be adjusted. See
00146  * mdc_adjust_dirpages().
00147  *
00148  */
00149 struct page *ll_get_dir_page(struct inode *dir, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00150                              __u64 offset, struct ll_dir_chain *chain)
00151 {
00152         struct md_callback      cb_op;
00153         struct page             *page;
00154         int                     rc;
00155 
00156         cb_op.md_blocking_ast = ll_md_blocking_ast;
00157         rc = md_read_page(ll_i2mdexp(dir), op_data, &cb_op, offset, &page);
00158         if (rc != 0)
00159                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00160 
00161         return page;
00162 }
00163 
00164 void ll_release_page(struct inode *inode, struct page *page,
00165                      bool remove)
00166 {
00167         kunmap(page);
00168 
00169         /* Always remove the page for striped dir, because the page is
00170          * built from temporarily in LMV layer */
00171         if (inode != NULL && S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode) &&
00172             ll_i2info(inode)->lli_lsm_md != NULL) {
00173                 __free_page(page);
00174                 return;
00175         }
00176 
00177         if (remove) {
00178                 lock_page(page);
00179                 if (likely(page->mapping != NULL))
00180                         truncate_complete_page(page->mapping, page);
00181                 unlock_page(page);
00182         }
00183         page_cache_release(page);
00184 }

00191 static u16 ll_dirent_type_get(struct lu_dirent *ent)
00192 {
00193         u16 type = 0;
00194         struct luda_type *lt;
00195         int len = 0;
00196 
00197         if (le32_to_cpu(ent->lde_attrs) & LUDA_TYPE) {
00198                 const unsigned align = sizeof(struct luda_type) - 1;
00199 
00200                 len = le16_to_cpu(ent->lde_namelen);
00201                 len = (len + align) & ~align;
00202                 lt = (void *)ent->lde_name + len;
00203                 type = IFTODT(le16_to_cpu(lt->lt_type));
00204         }
00205 
00206         return type;
00207 }

00209 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00210 int ll_dir_read(struct inode *inode, __u64 *ppos, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00211                 struct dir_context *ctx)
00212 {
00213 #else
00214 int ll_dir_read(struct inode *inode, __u64 *ppos, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00215                 void *cookie, filldir_t filldir)
00216 {
00217 #endif
00218         struct ll_sb_info    *sbi        = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00219         __u64                 pos        = *ppos;
00220         bool                  is_api32 = ll_need_32bit_api(sbi);
00221         bool                  is_hash64 = sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_64BIT_HASH;
00222         struct page          *page;
00223         struct ll_dir_chain   chain;
00224         bool                  done = false;
00225         int                   rc = 0;
00226         ENTRY;
00227 
00228         ll_dir_chain_init(&chain);
00229 
00230         page = ll_get_dir_page(inode, op_data, pos, &chain);
00231 
00232         while (rc == 0 && !done) {
00233                 struct lu_dirpage *dp;
00234                 struct lu_dirent  *ent;
00235                 __u64 hash;
00236                 __u64 next;
00237 
00238                 if (IS_ERR(page)) {
00239                         rc = PTR_ERR(page);
00240                         break;
00241                 }
00242 
00243                 hash = MDS_DIR_END_OFF;
00244                 dp = page_address(page);
00245                 for (ent = lu_dirent_start(dp); ent != NULL && !done;
00246                      ent = lu_dirent_next(ent)) {
00247                         __u16          type;
00248                         int            namelen;
00249                         struct lu_fid  fid;
00250                         __u64          lhash;
00251                         __u64          ino;
00252 
00253                         hash = le64_to_cpu(ent->lde_hash);
00254                         if (hash < pos)
00255                                 /*
00256                                  * Skip until we find target hash
00257                                  * value.
00258                                  */
00259                                 continue;
00260 
00261                         namelen = le16_to_cpu(ent->lde_namelen);
00262                         if (namelen == 0)
00263                                 /*
00264                                  * Skip dummy record.
00265                                  */
00266                                 continue;
00267 
00268                         if (is_api32 && is_hash64)
00269                                 lhash = hash >> 32;
00270                         else
00271                                 lhash = hash;
00272                         fid_le_to_cpu(&fid, &ent->lde_fid);
00273                         ino = cl_fid_build_ino(&fid, is_api32);
00274                         type = ll_dirent_type_get(ent);
00275                         /* For 'll_nfs_get_name_filldir()', it will try
00276                          * to access the 'ent' through its 'lde_name',
00277                          * so the parameter 'name' for 'filldir()' must
00278                          * be part of the 'ent'. */
00279 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00280                         ctx->pos = lhash;
00281                         done = !dir_emit(ctx, ent->lde_name, namelen, ino,
00282                                          type);
00283 #else
00284                         done = filldir(cookie, ent->lde_name, namelen, lhash,
00285                                        ino, type);
00286 #endif
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 if (done) {
00290                         pos = hash;
00291                         ll_release_page(inode, page, false);
00292                         break;
00293                 }
00294 
00295                 next = le64_to_cpu(dp->ldp_hash_end);
00296                 pos = next;
00297                 if (pos == MDS_DIR_END_OFF) {
00298                         /*
00299                          * End of directory reached.
00300                          */
00301                         done = 1;
00302                         ll_release_page(inode, page, false);
00303                 } else {
00304                         /*
00305                          * Normal case: continue to the next
00306                          * page.
00307                          */
00308                         ll_release_page(inode, page,
00309                                         le32_to_cpu(dp->ldp_flags) &
00310                                         LDF_COLLIDE);
00311                         next = pos;
00312                         page = ll_get_dir_page(inode, op_data, pos,
00313                                                &chain);
00314                 }
00315         }
00316 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00317         ctx->pos = pos;
00318 #else
00319         *ppos = pos;
00320 #endif
00321         ll_dir_chain_fini(&chain);
00322         RETURN(rc);
00323 }
00324 
00325 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00326 static int ll_iterate(struct file *filp, struct dir_context *ctx)
00327 #else
00328 static int ll_readdir(struct file *filp, void *cookie, filldir_t filldir)
00329 #endif
00330 {
00331         struct inode            *inode  = filp->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
00332         struct ll_file_data     *lfd    = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(filp);
00333         struct ll_sb_info       *sbi    = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00334         int                     hash64  = sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_64BIT_HASH;
00335         int                     api32   = ll_need_32bit_api(sbi);
00336         struct md_op_data       *op_data;
00337         __u64                   pos;
00338         int                     rc;
00339         ENTRY;
00340 
00341         if (lfd != NULL)
00342                 pos = lfd->lfd_pos;
00343         else
00344                 pos = 0;
00345 
00346         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p) pos/size"
00347                "%lu/%llu 32bit_api %d\n", PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
00348                inode, (unsigned long)pos, i_size_read(inode), api32);
00349 
00350         if (pos == MDS_DIR_END_OFF)
00351                 /*
00352                  * end-of-file.
00353                  */
00354                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00355 
00356         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, inode, NULL, 0, 0,
00357                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, inode);
00358         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00359                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(op_data));
00360 
00361         if (unlikely(op_data->op_mea1 != NULL)) {
00362                 /* This is only needed for striped dir to fill ..,
00363                  * see lmv_read_entry */
00364                 if (filp->f_path.dentry->d_parent != NULL &&
00365                     filp->f_path.dentry->d_parent->d_inode != NULL) {
00366                         __u64 ibits = MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE;
00367                         struct inode *parent =
00368                                 filp->f_path.dentry->d_parent->d_inode;
00369 
00370                         if (ll_have_md_lock(parent, &ibits, LCK_MINMODE))
00371                                 op_data->op_fid3 = *ll_inode2fid(parent);
00372                 }
00373 
00374                 /* If it can not find in cache, do lookup .. on the master
00375                  * object */
00376                 if (fid_is_zero(&op_data->op_fid3)) {
00377                         rc = ll_dir_get_parent_fid(inode, &op_data->op_fid3);
00378                         if (rc != 0) {
00379                                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00380                                 RETURN(rc);
00381                         }
00382                 }
00383         }
00384         op_data->op_max_pages = sbi->ll_md_brw_pages;
00385 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00386         ctx->pos = pos;
00387         rc = ll_dir_read(inode, &pos, op_data, ctx);
00388         pos = ctx->pos;
00389 #else
00390         rc = ll_dir_read(inode, &pos, op_data, cookie, filldir);
00391 #endif
00392         if (lfd != NULL)
00393                 lfd->lfd_pos = pos;
00394 
00395         if (pos == MDS_DIR_END_OFF) {
00396                 if (api32)
00397                         pos = LL_DIR_END_OFF_32BIT;
00398                 else
00399                         pos = LL_DIR_END_OFF;
00400         } else {
00401                 if (api32 && hash64)
00402                         pos = pos >> 32;
00403         }
00404 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00405         ctx->pos = pos;
00406 #else
00407         filp->f_pos = pos;
00408 #endif
00409         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00410         filp->f_version = inode->i_version;
00411 
00412 out:
00413         if (!rc)
00414                 ll_stats_ops_tally(sbi, LPROC_LL_READDIR, 1);
00415 
00416         RETURN(rc);
00417 }
00418 
00419 static int ll_send_mgc_param(struct obd_export *mgc, char *string)
00420 {
00421         struct mgs_send_param *msp;
00422         int rc = 0;
00423 
00424         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(msp);
00425         if (!msp)
00426                 return -ENOMEM;
00427 
00428         strlcpy(msp->mgs_param, string, sizeof(msp->mgs_param));
00429         rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, mgc, sizeof(KEY_SET_INFO), KEY_SET_INFO,
00430                                 sizeof(struct mgs_send_param), msp, NULL);
00431         if (rc)
00432                 CERROR("Failed to set parameter: %d\n", rc);
00433         OBD_FREE_PTR(msp);
00434 
00435         return rc;
00436 }
00437 
00449 static int ll_dir_setdirstripe(struct inode *parent, struct lmv_user_md *lump,
00450                                const char *dirname, umode_t mode)
00451 {
00452         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
00453         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00454         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(parent);
00455         struct inode *inode = NULL;
00456         struct dentry dentry;
00457         int err;
00458         ENTRY;
00459 
00460         if (unlikely(lump->lum_magic != LMV_USER_MAGIC))
00461                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00462 
00463         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p) name %s"
00464                "stripe_offset %d, stripe_count: %u\n",
00465                PFID(ll_inode2fid(parent)), parent, dirname,
00466                (int)lump->lum_stripe_offset, lump->lum_stripe_count);
00467 
00468         if (lump->lum_stripe_count > 1 &&
00469             !(exp_connect_flags(sbi->ll_md_exp) & OBD_CONNECT_DIR_STRIPE))
00470                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00471 
00472         if (IS_DEADDIR(parent) &&
00473             !OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LLITE_NO_CHECK_DEAD))
00474                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00475 
00476         if (lump->lum_magic != cpu_to_le32(LMV_USER_MAGIC))
00477                 lustre_swab_lmv_user_md(lump);
00478 
00479         if (!IS_POSIXACL(parent) || !exp_connect_umask(ll_i2mdexp(parent)))
00480                 mode &= ~current_umask();
00481         mode = (mode & (S_IRWXUGO | S_ISVTX)) | S_IFDIR;
00482         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, parent, NULL, dirname,
00483                                      strlen(dirname), mode, LUSTRE_OPC_MKDIR,
00484                                      lump);
00485         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00486                 GOTO(err_exit, err = PTR_ERR(op_data));
00487 
00488         op_data->op_cli_flags |= CLI_SET_MEA;
00489         err = md_create(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, lump, sizeof(*lump), mode,
00490                         from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_fsuid()),
00491                         from_kgid(&init_user_ns, current_fsgid()),
00492                         cfs_curproc_cap_pack(), 0, &request);
00493         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00494         if (err)
00495                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
00496 
00497         err = ll_prep_inode(&inode, request, parent->i_sb, NULL);
00498         if (err)
00499                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
00500 
00501         memset(&dentry, 0, sizeof(dentry));
00502         dentry.d_inode = inode;
00503 
00504         err = ll_init_security(&dentry, inode, parent);
00505         iput(inode);
00506         if (err)
00507                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
00508 
00509 err_exit:
00510         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
00511         return err;
00512 }
00513 
00514 int ll_dir_setstripe(struct inode *inode, struct lov_user_md *lump,
00515                      int set_default)
00516 {
00517         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00518         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00519         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00520         int rc = 0;
00521         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(inode->i_sb);
00522         struct obd_device *mgc = lsi->lsi_mgc;
00523         int lum_size;
00524         ENTRY;
00525 
00526         if (lump != NULL) {
00527                 /*
00528                  * This is coming from userspace, so should be in
00529                  * local endian.  But the MDS would like it in little
00530                  * endian, so we swab it before we send it.
00531                  */
00532                 switch (lump->lmm_magic) {
00533                 case LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1: {
00534                         if (lump->lmm_magic != cpu_to_le32(LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1))
00535                                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v1(lump);
00536                         lum_size = sizeof(struct lov_user_md_v1);
00537                         break;
00538                 }
00539                 case LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3: {
00540                         if (lump->lmm_magic != cpu_to_le32(LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3))
00541                                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v3(
00542                                         (struct lov_user_md_v3 *)lump);
00543                         lum_size = sizeof(struct lov_user_md_v3);
00544                         break;
00545                 }
00546                 case LMV_USER_MAGIC: {
00547                         if (lump->lmm_magic != cpu_to_le32(LMV_USER_MAGIC))
00548                                 lustre_swab_lmv_user_md(
00549                                         (struct lmv_user_md *)lump);
00550                         lum_size = sizeof(struct lmv_user_md);
00551                         break;
00552                 }
00553                 default: {
00554                         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "bad userland LOV MAGIC:"
00555                                         " %#08x != %#08x nor %#08x\n",
00556                                         lump->lmm_magic, LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1,
00557                                         LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3);
00558                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00559                 }
00560                 }
00561         } else {
00562                 lum_size = sizeof(struct lov_user_md_v1);
00563         }
00564 
00565         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, NULL, NULL, 0, 0,
00566                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
00567         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00568                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
00569 
00570         /* swabbing is done in lov_setstripe() on server side */
00571         rc = md_setattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, lump, lum_size, &req);
00572         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00573         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00574         if (rc) {
00575                 if (rc != -EPERM && rc != -EACCES)
00576                         CERROR("mdc_setattr fails: rc = %d\n", rc);
00577         }
00578 
00579         /* In the following we use the fact that LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1 and
00580          LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3 have the same initial fields so we do not
00581          need the make the distiction between the 2 versions */
00582         if (set_default && mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp) {
00583                 char *param = NULL;
00584                 char *buf;
00585 
00586                 OBD_ALLOC(param, MGS_PARAM_MAXLEN);
00587                 if (param == NULL)
00588                         GOTO(end, rc = -ENOMEM);
00589 
00590                 buf = param;
00591                 /* Get fsname and assume devname to be -MDT0000. */
00592                 ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, buf, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00593                 strcat(buf, "-MDT0000.lov");
00594                 buf += strlen(buf);
00595 
00596                 /* Set root stripesize */
00597                 sprintf(buf, ".stripesize=%u",
00598                         lump ? le32_to_cpu(lump->lmm_stripe_size) : 0);
00599                 rc = ll_send_mgc_param(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, param);
00600                 if (rc)
00601                         GOTO(end, rc);
00602 
00603                 /* Set root stripecount */
00604                 sprintf(buf, ".stripecount=%hd",
00605                         lump ? le16_to_cpu(lump->lmm_stripe_count) : 0);
00606                 rc = ll_send_mgc_param(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, param);
00607                 if (rc)
00608                         GOTO(end, rc);
00609 
00610                 /* Set root stripeoffset */
00611                 sprintf(buf, ".stripeoffset=%hd",
00612                         lump ? le16_to_cpu(lump->lmm_stripe_offset) :
00613                         (typeof(lump->lmm_stripe_offset))(-1));
00614                 rc = ll_send_mgc_param(mgc->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp, param);
00615 
00616 end:
00617                 if (param != NULL)
00618                         OBD_FREE(param, MGS_PARAM_MAXLEN);
00619         }
00620         RETURN(rc);
00621 }
00622 
00631 int ll_dir_getstripe(struct inode *inode, void **plmm, int *plmm_size,
00632                      struct ptlrpc_request **request, u64 valid)
00633 {
00634         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00635         struct mdt_body   *body;
00636         struct lov_mds_md *lmm = NULL;
00637         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00638         int rc, lmm_size;
00639         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00640         ENTRY;
00641 
00642         rc = ll_get_default_mdsize(sbi, &lmm_size);
00643         if (rc)
00644                 RETURN(rc);
00645 
00646         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, inode, NULL, NULL,
00647                                      0, lmm_size, LUSTRE_OPC_ANY,
00648                                      NULL);
00649         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00650                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
00651 
00652         op_data->op_valid = valid | OBD_MD_FLEASIZE | OBD_MD_FLDIREA;
00653         rc = md_getattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &req);
00654         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00655         if (rc < 0) {
00656                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "md_getattr failed on inode "
00657                        DFID": rc %d\n", PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), rc);
00658                 GOTO(out, rc);
00659         }
00660 
00661         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00662         LASSERT(body != NULL);
00663 
00664         lmm_size = body->mbo_eadatasize;
00665 
00666         if (!(body->mbo_valid & (OBD_MD_FLEASIZE | OBD_MD_FLDIREA)) ||
00667             lmm_size == 0) {
00668                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODATA);
00669         }
00670 
00671         lmm = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill,
00672                                            &RMF_MDT_MD, lmm_size);
00673         LASSERT(lmm != NULL);
00674 
00675         /*
00676          * This is coming from the MDS, so is probably in
00677          * little endian.  We convert it to host endian before
00678          * passing it to userspace.
00679          */
00680         /* We don't swab objects for directories */
00681         switch (le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic)) {
00682         case LOV_MAGIC_V1:
00683                 if (LOV_MAGIC != cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC))
00684                         lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v1((struct lov_user_md_v1 *)lmm);
00685                 break;
00686         case LOV_MAGIC_V3:
00687                 if (LOV_MAGIC != cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC))
00688                         lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v3((struct lov_user_md_v3 *)lmm);
00689                 break;
00690         case LMV_MAGIC_V1:
00691                 if (LMV_MAGIC != cpu_to_le32(LMV_MAGIC))
00692                         lustre_swab_lmv_mds_md((union lmv_mds_md *)lmm);
00693                 break;
00694         case LMV_USER_MAGIC:
00695                 if (LMV_USER_MAGIC != cpu_to_le32(LMV_USER_MAGIC))
00696                         lustre_swab_lmv_user_md((struct lmv_user_md *)lmm);
00697                 break;
00698         default:
00699                 CERROR("unknown magic: %lX\n", (unsigned long)lmm->lmm_magic);
00700                 rc = -EPROTO;
00701         }
00702 out:
00703         *plmm = lmm;
00704         *plmm_size = lmm_size;
00705         *request = req;
00706         return rc;
00707 }
00708 
00709 int ll_get_mdt_idx_by_fid(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, const struct lu_fid *fid)
00710 {
00711         struct md_op_data       *op_data;
00712         int                     rc;
00713         int                     mdt_index;
00714         ENTRY;
00715 
00716         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
00717         if (op_data == NULL)
00718                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00719 
00720         op_data->op_flags |= MF_GET_MDT_IDX;
00721         op_data->op_fid1 = *fid;
00722         rc = md_getattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, NULL);
00723         mdt_index = op_data->op_mds;
00724         OBD_FREE_PTR(op_data);
00725         if (rc < 0)
00726                 RETURN(rc);
00727 
00728         RETURN(mdt_index);
00729 }
00730 
00731 /*
00732  *  Get MDT index for the inode.
00733  */
00734 int ll_get_mdt_idx(struct inode *inode)
00735 {
00736         return ll_get_mdt_idx_by_fid(ll_i2sbi(inode), ll_inode2fid(inode));
00737 }
00738 
00750 static int ll_ioc_copy_start(struct super_block *sb, struct hsm_copy *copy)
00751 {
00752         struct ll_sb_info               *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00753         struct hsm_progress_kernel       hpk;
00754         int                              rc = 0;
00755         int                              rc2;
00756         ENTRY;
00757 
00758         /* Forge a hsm_progress based on data from copy. */
00759         hpk.hpk_fid = copy->hc_hai.hai_fid;
00760         hpk.hpk_cookie = copy->hc_hai.hai_cookie;
00761         hpk.hpk_extent.offset = copy->hc_hai.hai_extent.offset;
00762         hpk.hpk_extent.length = 0;
00763         hpk.hpk_flags = 0;
00764         hpk.hpk_errval = 0;
00765         hpk.hpk_data_version = 0;
00766 
00767 
00768         /* For archive request, we need to read the current file version. */
00769         if (copy->hc_hai.hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE) {
00770                 struct inode    *inode;
00771                 __u64            data_version = 0;
00772 
00773                 /* Get inode for this fid */
00774                 inode = search_inode_for_lustre(sb, &copy->hc_hai.hai_fid);
00775                 if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00776                         hpk.hpk_flags |= HP_FLAG_RETRY;
00777                         /* hpk_errval is >= 0 */
00778                         hpk.hpk_errval = -PTR_ERR(inode);
00779                         GOTO(progress, rc = PTR_ERR(inode));
00780                 }
00781 
00782                 /* Read current file data version */
00783                 rc = ll_data_version(inode, &data_version, LL_DV_RD_FLUSH);
00784                 iput(inode);
00785                 if (rc != 0) {
00786                         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "Could not read file data version of "
00787                                       DFID" (rc = %d). Archive request ("
00788                                       LPX64") could not be done.\n",
00789                                       PFID(&copy->hc_hai.hai_fid), rc,
00790                                       copy->hc_hai.hai_cookie);
00791                         hpk.hpk_flags |= HP_FLAG_RETRY;
00792                         /* hpk_errval must be >= 0 */
00793                         hpk.hpk_errval = -rc;
00794                         GOTO(progress, rc);
00795                 }
00796 
00797                 /* Store in the hsm_copy for later copytool use.
00798                  * Always modified even if no lsm. */
00799                 copy->hc_data_version = data_version;
00800         }
00801 
00802 progress:
00803         /* On error, the request should be considered as completed */
00804         if (hpk.hpk_errval > 0)
00805                 hpk.hpk_flags |= HP_FLAG_COMPLETED;
00806 
00807         rc2 = obd_iocontrol(LL_IOC_HSM_PROGRESS, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(hpk),
00808                             &hpk, NULL);
00809 
00810         /* Return first error */
00811         RETURN(rc != 0 ? rc : rc2);
00812 }
00813 
00829 static int ll_ioc_copy_end(struct super_block *sb, struct hsm_copy *copy)
00830 {
00831         struct ll_sb_info               *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00832         struct hsm_progress_kernel       hpk;
00833         int                              rc = 0;
00834         int                              rc2;
00835         ENTRY;
00836 
00837         /* If you modify the logic here, also check llapi_hsm_copy_end(). */
00838         /* Take care: copy->hc_hai.hai_action, len, gid and data are not
00839          * initialized if copy_end was called with copy == NULL.
00840          */
00841 
00842         /* Forge a hsm_progress based on data from copy. */
00843         hpk.hpk_fid = copy->hc_hai.hai_fid;
00844         hpk.hpk_cookie = copy->hc_hai.hai_cookie;
00845         hpk.hpk_extent = copy->hc_hai.hai_extent;
00846         hpk.hpk_flags = copy->hc_flags | HP_FLAG_COMPLETED;
00847         hpk.hpk_errval = copy->hc_errval;
00848         hpk.hpk_data_version = 0;
00849 
00850         /* For archive request, we need to check the file data was not changed.
00851          *
00852          * For restore request, we need to send the file data version, this is
00853          * useful when the file was created using hsm_import.
00854          */
00855         if (((copy->hc_hai.hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE) ||
00856              (copy->hc_hai.hai_action == HSMA_RESTORE)) &&
00857             (copy->hc_errval == 0)) {
00858                 struct inode    *inode;
00859                 __u64            data_version = 0;
00860 
00861                 /* Get lsm for this fid */
00862                 inode = search_inode_for_lustre(sb, &copy->hc_hai.hai_fid);
00863                 if (IS_ERR(inode)) {
00864                         hpk.hpk_flags |= HP_FLAG_RETRY;
00865                         /* hpk_errval must be >= 0 */
00866                         hpk.hpk_errval = -PTR_ERR(inode);
00867                         GOTO(progress, rc = PTR_ERR(inode));
00868                 }
00869 
00870                 rc = ll_data_version(inode, &data_version, LL_DV_RD_FLUSH);
00871                 iput(inode);
00872                 if (rc) {
00873                         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "Could not read file data version. "
00874                                       "Request could not be confirmed.\n");
00875                         if (hpk.hpk_errval == 0)
00876                                 hpk.hpk_errval = -rc;
00877                         GOTO(progress, rc);
00878                 }
00879 
00880                 /* Store in the hsm_copy for later copytool use.
00881                  * Always modified even if no lsm. */
00882                 hpk.hpk_data_version = data_version;
00883 
00884                 /* File could have been stripped during archiving, so we need
00885                  * to check anyway. */
00886                 if ((copy->hc_hai.hai_action == HSMA_ARCHIVE) &&
00887                     (copy->hc_data_version != data_version)) {
00888                         CDEBUG(D_HSM, "File data version mismatched. "
00889                               "File content was changed during archiving. "
00890                                DFID", start:"LPX64" current:"LPX64"\n",
00891                                PFID(&copy->hc_hai.hai_fid),
00892                                copy->hc_data_version, data_version);
00893                         /* File was changed, send error to cdt. Do not ask for
00894                          * retry because if a file is modified frequently,
00895                          * the cdt will loop on retried archive requests.
00896                          * The policy engine will ask for a new archive later
00897                          * when the file will not be modified for some tunable
00898                          * time */
00899                         hpk.hpk_flags &= ~HP_FLAG_RETRY;
00900                         rc = -EBUSY;
00901                         /* hpk_errval must be >= 0 */
00902                         hpk.hpk_errval = -rc;
00903                         GOTO(progress, rc);
00904                 }
00905 
00906         }
00907 
00908 progress:
00909         rc2 = obd_iocontrol(LL_IOC_HSM_PROGRESS, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(hpk),
00910                             &hpk, NULL);
00911 
00912         /* Return first error */
00913         RETURN(rc != 0 ? rc : rc2);
00914 }
00915 
00916 
00917 static int copy_and_ioctl(int cmd, struct obd_export *exp,
00918                           const void __user *data, size_t size)
00919 {
00920         void *copy;
00921         int rc;
00922 
00923         OBD_ALLOC(copy, size);
00924         if (copy == NULL)
00925                 return -ENOMEM;
00926 
00927         if (copy_from_user(copy, data, size)) {
00928                 rc = -EFAULT;
00929                 goto out;
00930         }
00931 
00932         rc = obd_iocontrol(cmd, exp, size, copy, NULL);
00933 out:
00934         OBD_FREE(copy, size);
00935 
00936         return rc;
00937 }
00938 
00939 static int quotactl_ioctl(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, struct if_quotactl *qctl)
00940 {
00941         int cmd = qctl->qc_cmd;
00942         int type = qctl->qc_type;
00943         int id = qctl->qc_id;
00944         int valid = qctl->qc_valid;
00945         int rc = 0;
00946         ENTRY;
00947 
00948         switch (cmd) {
00949         case Q_SETQUOTA:
00950         case Q_SETINFO:
00951                 if (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN) ||
00952                     sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)
00953                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00954                 break;
00955         case Q_GETQUOTA:
00956                 if (((type == USRQUOTA &&
00957                       !uid_eq(current_euid(), make_kuid(&init_user_ns, id))) ||
00958                      (type == GRPQUOTA &&
00959                       !in_egroup_p(make_kgid(&init_user_ns, id)))) &&
00960                     (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN) ||
00961                      sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT))
00962                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00963                 break;
00964         case Q_GETINFO:
00965                 break;
00966         default:
00967                 CERROR("unsupported quotactl op: %#x\n", cmd);
00968                 RETURN(-ENOTTY);
00969         }
00970 
00971         if (valid != QC_GENERAL) {
00972                 if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT)
00973                         RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00974 
00975                 if (cmd == Q_GETINFO)
00976                         qctl->qc_cmd = Q_GETOINFO;
00977                 else if (cmd == Q_GETQUOTA)
00978                         qctl->qc_cmd = Q_GETOQUOTA;
00979                 else
00980                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00981 
00982                 switch (valid) {
00983                 case QC_MDTIDX:
00984                         rc = obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL, sbi->ll_md_exp,
00985                                            sizeof(*qctl), qctl, NULL);
00986                         break;
00987                 case QC_OSTIDX:
00988                         rc = obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL, sbi->ll_dt_exp,
00989                                            sizeof(*qctl), qctl, NULL);
00990                         break;
00991                 case QC_UUID:
00992                         rc = obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL, sbi->ll_md_exp,
00993                                            sizeof(*qctl), qctl, NULL);
00994                         if (rc == -EAGAIN)
00995                                 rc = obd_iocontrol(OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL,
00996                                                    sbi->ll_dt_exp,
00997                                                    sizeof(*qctl), qctl, NULL);
00998                         break;
00999                 default:
01000                         rc = -EINVAL;
01001                         break;
01002                 }
01003 
01004                 if (rc)
01005                         RETURN(rc);
01006 
01007                 qctl->qc_cmd = cmd;
01008         } else {
01009                 struct obd_quotactl *oqctl;
01010 
01011                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oqctl);
01012                 if (oqctl == NULL)
01013                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01014 
01015                 QCTL_COPY(oqctl, qctl);
01016                 rc = obd_quotactl(sbi->ll_md_exp, oqctl);
01017                 if (rc) {
01018                         OBD_FREE_PTR(oqctl);
01019                         RETURN(rc);
01020                 }
01021                 /* If QIF_SPACE is not set, client should collect the
01022                  * space usage from OSSs by itself */
01023                 if (cmd == Q_GETQUOTA &&
01024                     !(oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_valid & QIF_SPACE) &&
01025                     !oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace) {
01026                         struct obd_quotactl *oqctl_tmp;
01027 
01028                         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oqctl_tmp);
01029                         if (oqctl_tmp == NULL)
01030                                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01031 
01032                         oqctl_tmp->qc_cmd = Q_GETOQUOTA;
01033                         oqctl_tmp->qc_id = oqctl->qc_id;
01034                         oqctl_tmp->qc_type = oqctl->qc_type;
01035 
01036                         /* collect space usage from OSTs */
01037                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace = 0;
01038                         rc = obd_quotactl(sbi->ll_dt_exp, oqctl_tmp);
01039                         if (!rc || rc == -EREMOTEIO) {
01040                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace =
01041                                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace;
01042                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_valid |= QIF_SPACE;
01043                         }
01044 
01045                         /* collect space & inode usage from MDTs */
01046                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace = 0;
01047                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curinodes = 0;
01048                         rc = obd_quotactl(sbi->ll_md_exp, oqctl_tmp);
01049                         if (!rc || rc == -EREMOTEIO) {
01050                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace +=
01051                                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace;
01052                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curinodes =
01053                                         oqctl_tmp->qc_dqblk.dqb_curinodes;
01054                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_valid |= QIF_INODES;
01055                         } else {
01056                                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_valid &= ~QIF_SPACE;
01057                         }
01058 
01059                         OBD_FREE_PTR(oqctl_tmp);
01060                 }
01061 out:
01062                 QCTL_COPY(qctl, oqctl);
01063                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oqctl);
01064         }
01065 
01066         RETURN(rc);
01067 }
01068 
01069 /* This function tries to get a single name component,
01070  * to send to the server. No actual path traversal involved,
01071  * so we limit to NAME_MAX */
01072 static char *ll_getname(const char __user *filename)
01073 {
01074         int ret = 0, len;
01075         char *tmp;
01076 
01077         OBD_ALLOC(tmp, NAME_MAX + 1);
01078 
01079         if (!tmp)
01080                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01081 
01082         len = strncpy_from_user(tmp, filename, NAME_MAX + 1);
01083         if (len < 0)
01084                 ret = -ENOENT;
01085         else if (len > NAME_MAX)
01086                 ret = -ENAMETOOLONG;
01087 
01088         if (ret) {
01089                 OBD_FREE(tmp, NAME_MAX + 1);
01090                 tmp =  ERR_PTR(ret);
01091         }
01092         return tmp;
01093 }
01094 
01095 #define ll_putname(filename) OBD_FREE(filename, NAME_MAX + 1);
01096 
01097 static long ll_dir_ioctl(struct file *file, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
01098 {
01099         struct inode *inode = file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
01100         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01101         struct obd_ioctl_data *data;
01102         int rc = 0;
01103         ENTRY;
01104 
01105         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:inode="DFID"(%p), cmd=%#x\n",
01106                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode, cmd);
01107 
01108         /* asm-ppc{,64} declares TCGETS, et. al. as type 't' not 'T' */
01109         if (_IOC_TYPE(cmd) == 'T' || _IOC_TYPE(cmd) == 't') /* tty ioctls */
01110                 return -ENOTTY;
01111 
01112         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(inode), LPROC_LL_IOCTL, 1);
01113         switch(cmd) {
01114         case FSFILT_IOC_GETFLAGS:
01115         case FSFILT_IOC_SETFLAGS:
01116                 RETURN(ll_iocontrol(inode, file, cmd, arg));
01117         case FSFILT_IOC_GETVERSION_OLD:
01118         case FSFILT_IOC_GETVERSION:
01119                 RETURN(put_user(inode->i_generation, (int __user *)arg));
01120         /* We need to special case any other ioctls we want to handle,
01121          * to send them to the MDS/OST as appropriate and to properly
01122          * network encode the arg field.
01123         case FSFILT_IOC_SETVERSION_OLD:
01124         case FSFILT_IOC_SETVERSION:
01125         */
01126         case LL_IOC_GET_MDTIDX: {
01127                 int mdtidx;
01128 
01129                 mdtidx = ll_get_mdt_idx(inode);
01130                 if (mdtidx < 0)
01131                         RETURN(mdtidx);
01132 
01133                 if (put_user((int)mdtidx, (int __user *)arg))
01134                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01135 
01136                 return 0;
01137         }
01138         case IOC_MDC_LOOKUP: {
01139                 int namelen, len = 0;
01140                 char *buf = NULL;
01141                 char *filename;
01142 
01143                 rc = obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, (void __user *)arg);
01144                 if (rc != 0)
01145                         RETURN(rc);
01146                 data = (void *)buf;
01147 
01148                 filename = data->ioc_inlbuf1;
01149                 namelen = strlen(filename);
01150                 if (namelen < 1) {
01151                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "IOC_MDC_LOOKUP missing filename\n");
01152                         GOTO(out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01153                 }
01154 
01155                 rc = ll_get_fid_by_name(inode, filename, namelen, NULL, NULL);
01156                 if (rc < 0) {
01157                         CERROR("%s: lookup %.*s failed: rc = %d\n",
01158                                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0), namelen,
01159                                filename, rc);
01160                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
01161                 }
01162 out_free:
01163                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01164                 return rc;
01165         }
01166         case LL_IOC_LMV_SETSTRIPE: {
01167                 struct lmv_user_md  *lum;
01168                 char            *buf = NULL;
01169                 char            *filename;
01170                 int              namelen = 0;
01171                 int              lumlen = 0;
01172                 umode_t          mode;
01173                 int              len;
01174                 int              rc;
01175 
01176                 rc = obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, (void __user *)arg);
01177                 if (rc)
01178                         RETURN(rc);
01179 
01180                 data = (void *)buf;
01181                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL || data->ioc_inlbuf2 == NULL ||
01182                     data->ioc_inllen1 == 0 || data->ioc_inllen2 == 0)
01183                         GOTO(lmv_out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01184 
01185                 filename = data->ioc_inlbuf1;
01186                 namelen = data->ioc_inllen1;
01187 
01188                 if (namelen < 1) {
01189                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "IOC_MDC_LOOKUP missing filename\n");
01190                         GOTO(lmv_out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01191                 }
01192                 lum = (struct lmv_user_md *)data->ioc_inlbuf2;
01193                 lumlen = data->ioc_inllen2;
01194 
01195                 if (lum->lum_magic != LMV_USER_MAGIC ||
01196                     lumlen != sizeof(*lum)) {
01197                         CERROR("%s: wrong lum magic %x or size %d: rc = %d\n",
01198                                filename, lum->lum_magic, lumlen, -EFAULT);
01199                         GOTO(lmv_out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01200                 }
01201 
01202 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(2, 9, 50, 0)
01203                 mode = data->ioc_type != 0 ? data->ioc_type : S_IRWXUGO;
01204 #else
01205                 mode = data->ioc_type;
01206 #endif
01207                 rc = ll_dir_setdirstripe(inode, lum, filename, mode);
01208 lmv_out_free:
01209                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01210                 RETURN(rc);
01211 
01212         }
01213         case LL_IOC_LMV_SET_DEFAULT_STRIPE: {
01214                 struct lmv_user_md        lum;
01215                 struct lmv_user_md __user *ulump =
01216                                         (struct lmv_user_md __user *)arg;
01217                 int                       rc;
01218 
01219                 if (copy_from_user(&lum, ulump, sizeof(lum)))
01220                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01221 
01222                 if (lum.lum_magic != LMV_USER_MAGIC)
01223                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01224 
01225                 rc = ll_dir_setstripe(inode, (struct lov_user_md *)&lum, 0);
01226 
01227                 RETURN(rc);
01228         }
01229         case LL_IOC_LOV_SETSTRIPE: {
01230                 struct lov_user_md_v3 lumv3;
01231                 struct lov_user_md_v1 *lumv1 = (struct lov_user_md_v1 *)&lumv3;
01232                 struct lov_user_md_v1 __user *lumv1p =
01233                         (struct lov_user_md_v1 __user *)arg;
01234                 struct lov_user_md_v3 __user *lumv3p =
01235                         (struct lov_user_md_v3 __user *)arg;
01236 
01237                 int set_default = 0;
01238 
01239                 LASSERT(sizeof(lumv3) == sizeof(*lumv3p));
01240                 LASSERT(sizeof(lumv3.lmm_objects[0]) ==
01241                         sizeof(lumv3p->lmm_objects[0]));
01242                 /* first try with v1 which is smaller than v3 */
01243                 if (copy_from_user(lumv1, lumv1p, sizeof(*lumv1)))
01244                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01245 
01246                 if ((lumv1->lmm_magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3) ) {
01247                         if (copy_from_user(&lumv3, lumv3p, sizeof(lumv3)))
01248                                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
01249                 }
01250 
01251                 if (inode->i_sb->s_root == file->f_path.dentry)
01252                         set_default = 1;
01253 
01254                 /* in v1 and v3 cases lumv1 points to data */
01255                 rc = ll_dir_setstripe(inode, lumv1, set_default);
01256 
01257                 RETURN(rc);
01258         }
01259         case LL_IOC_LMV_GETSTRIPE: {
01260                 struct lmv_user_md __user *ulmv =
01261                                         (struct lmv_user_md __user *)arg;
01262                 struct lmv_user_md      lum;
01263                 struct ptlrpc_request   *request = NULL;
01264                 union lmv_mds_md        *lmm = NULL;
01265                 int                     lmmsize;
01266                 u64                     valid = 0;
01267                 struct lmv_user_md      *tmp = NULL;
01268                 int                     mdt_index;
01269                 int                     lum_size;
01270                 int                     stripe_count;
01271                 int                     max_stripe_count;
01272                 int                     i;
01273                 int                     rc;
01274 
01275                 if (copy_from_user(&lum, ulmv, sizeof(*ulmv)))
01276                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01277 
01278                 max_stripe_count = lum.lum_stripe_count;
01279                 /* lum_magic will indicate which stripe the ioctl will like
01280                  * to get, LMV_MAGIC_V1 is for normal LMV stripe, LMV_USER_MAGIC
01281                  * is for default LMV stripe */
01282                 if (lum.lum_magic == LMV_MAGIC_V1)
01283                         valid |= OBD_MD_MEA;
01284                 else if (lum.lum_magic == LMV_USER_MAGIC)
01285                         valid |= OBD_MD_DEFAULT_MEA;
01286                 else
01287                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01288 
01289                 rc = ll_dir_getstripe(inode, (void **)&lmm, &lmmsize, &request,
01290                                       valid);
01291                 if (rc != 0)
01292                         GOTO(finish_req, rc);
01293 
01294                 /* Get default LMV EA */
01295                 if (lum.lum_magic == LMV_USER_MAGIC) {
01296                         if (lmmsize > sizeof(*ulmv))
01297                                 GOTO(finish_req, rc = -EINVAL);
01298 
01299                         if (copy_to_user(ulmv, lmm, lmmsize))
01300                                 GOTO(finish_req, rc = -EFAULT);
01301 
01302                         GOTO(finish_req, rc);
01303                 }
01304 
01305                 stripe_count = lmv_mds_md_stripe_count_get(lmm);
01306                 if (max_stripe_count < stripe_count) {
01307                         lum.lum_stripe_count = stripe_count;
01308                         if (copy_to_user(ulmv, &lum, sizeof(lum)))
01309                                 GOTO(finish_req, rc = -EFAULT);
01310                         GOTO(finish_req, rc = -E2BIG);
01311                 }
01312 
01313                 lum_size = lmv_user_md_size(stripe_count, LMV_MAGIC_V1);
01314                 OBD_ALLOC(tmp, lum_size);
01315                 if (tmp == NULL)
01316                         GOTO(finish_req, rc = -ENOMEM);
01317 
01318                 mdt_index = ll_get_mdt_idx(inode);
01319                 if (mdt_index < 0)
01320                         GOTO(out_tmp, rc = -ENOMEM);
01321 
01322                 tmp->lum_magic = LMV_MAGIC_V1;
01323                 tmp->lum_stripe_count = 0;
01324                 tmp->lum_stripe_offset = mdt_index;
01325                 for (i = 0; i < stripe_count; i++) {
01326                         struct lu_fid   fid;
01327 
01328                         fid_le_to_cpu(&fid, &lmm->lmv_md_v1.lmv_stripe_fids[i]);
01329                         mdt_index = ll_get_mdt_idx_by_fid(sbi, &fid);
01330                         if (mdt_index < 0)
01331                                 GOTO(out_tmp, rc = mdt_index);
01332 
01333                         tmp->lum_objects[i].lum_mds = mdt_index;
01334                         tmp->lum_objects[i].lum_fid = fid;
01335                         tmp->lum_stripe_count++;
01336                 }
01337 
01338                 if (copy_to_user(ulmv, tmp, lum_size))
01339                         GOTO(out_tmp, rc = -EFAULT);
01340 out_tmp:
01341                 OBD_FREE(tmp, lum_size);
01342 finish_req:
01343                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01344                 return rc;
01345         }
01346 
01347         case LL_IOC_REMOVE_ENTRY: {
01348                 char            *filename = NULL;
01349                 int              namelen = 0;
01350                 int              rc;
01351 
01352                 /* Here is a little hack to avoid sending REINT_RMENTRY to
01353                  * unsupported server, which might crash the server(LU-2730),
01354                  * Because both LVB_TYPE and REINT_RMENTRY will be supported
01355                  * on 2.4, we use OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE to detect whether the
01356                  * server will support REINT_RMENTRY XXX*/
01357                 if (!(exp_connect_flags(sbi->ll_md_exp) & OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE))
01358                         RETURN(-ENOTSUPP);
01359 
01360                 filename = ll_getname((const char __user *)arg);
01361                 if (IS_ERR(filename))
01362                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(filename));
01363 
01364                 namelen = strlen(filename);
01365                 if (namelen < 1)
01366                         GOTO(out_rmdir, rc = -EINVAL);
01367 
01368                 rc = ll_rmdir_entry(inode, filename, namelen);
01369 out_rmdir:
01370                 if (filename)
01371                         ll_putname(filename);
01372                 RETURN(rc);
01373         }
01374         case LL_IOC_LOV_SWAP_LAYOUTS:
01375                 RETURN(-EPERM);
01376         case IOC_OBD_STATFS:
01377                 RETURN(ll_obd_statfs(inode, (void __user *)arg));
01378         case LL_IOC_LOV_GETSTRIPE:
01379         case LL_IOC_MDC_GETINFO:
01380         case IOC_MDC_GETFILEINFO:
01381         case IOC_MDC_GETFILESTRIPE: {
01382                 struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01383                 struct lov_user_md __user *lump;
01384                 struct lov_mds_md *lmm = NULL;
01385                 struct mdt_body *body;
01386                 char *filename = NULL;
01387                 int lmmsize;
01388 
01389                 if (cmd == IOC_MDC_GETFILEINFO ||
01390                     cmd == IOC_MDC_GETFILESTRIPE) {
01391                         filename = ll_getname((const char __user *)arg);
01392                         if (IS_ERR(filename))
01393                                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(filename));
01394 
01395                         rc = ll_lov_getstripe_ea_info(inode, filename, &lmm,
01396                                                       &lmmsize, &request);
01397                 } else {
01398                         rc = ll_dir_getstripe(inode, (void **)&lmm, &lmmsize,
01399                                               &request, 0);
01400                 }
01401 
01402                 if (request) {
01403                         body = req_capsule_server_get(&request->rq_pill,
01404                                                       &RMF_MDT_BODY);
01405                         LASSERT(body != NULL);
01406                 } else {
01407                         GOTO(out_req, rc);
01408                 }
01409 
01410                 if (rc < 0) {
01411                         if (rc == -ENODATA && (cmd == IOC_MDC_GETFILEINFO ||
01412                                                cmd == LL_IOC_MDC_GETINFO))
01413                                 GOTO(skip_lmm, rc = 0);
01414                         else
01415                                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
01416                 }
01417 
01418                 if (cmd == IOC_MDC_GETFILESTRIPE ||
01419                     cmd == LL_IOC_LOV_GETSTRIPE) {
01420                         lump = (struct lov_user_md __user *)arg;
01421                 } else {
01422                         struct lov_user_mds_data __user *lmdp;
01423                         lmdp = (struct lov_user_mds_data __user *)arg;
01424                         lump = &lmdp->lmd_lmm;
01425                 }
01426                 if (copy_to_user(lump, lmm, lmmsize)) {
01427                         if (copy_to_user(lump, lmm, sizeof(*lump)))
01428                                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EFAULT);
01429                         rc = -EOVERFLOW;
01430                 }
01431         skip_lmm:
01432                 if (cmd == IOC_MDC_GETFILEINFO || cmd == LL_IOC_MDC_GETINFO) {
01433                         struct lov_user_mds_data __user *lmdp;
01434                         lstat_t st = { 0 };
01435 
01436                         st.st_dev       = inode->i_sb->s_dev;
01437                         st.st_mode      = body->mbo_mode;
01438                         st.st_nlink     = body->mbo_nlink;
01439                         st.st_uid       = body->mbo_uid;
01440                         st.st_gid       = body->mbo_gid;
01441                         st.st_rdev      = body->mbo_rdev;
01442                         st.st_size      = body->mbo_size;
01443                         st.st_blksize   = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01444                         st.st_blocks    = body->mbo_blocks;
01445                         st.st_atime     = body->mbo_atime;
01446                         st.st_mtime     = body->mbo_mtime;
01447                         st.st_ctime     = body->mbo_ctime;
01448                         st.st_ino       = inode->i_ino;
01449 
01450                         lmdp = (struct lov_user_mds_data __user *)arg;
01451                         if (copy_to_user(&lmdp->lmd_st, &st, sizeof(st)))
01452                                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EFAULT);
01453                 }
01454 
01455                 EXIT;
01456         out_req:
01457                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01458                 if (filename)
01459                         ll_putname(filename);
01460                 return rc;
01461         }
01462         case OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL: {
01463                 struct if_quotactl *qctl;
01464 
01465                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(qctl);
01466                 if (!qctl)
01467                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01468 
01469                 if (copy_from_user(qctl, (void __user *)arg, sizeof(*qctl)))
01470                         GOTO(out_quotactl, rc = -EFAULT);
01471 
01472                 rc = quotactl_ioctl(sbi, qctl);
01473 
01474                 if (rc == 0 &&
01475                     copy_to_user((void __user *)arg, qctl, sizeof(*qctl)))
01476                         rc = -EFAULT;
01477 
01478         out_quotactl:
01479                 OBD_FREE_PTR(qctl);
01480                 RETURN(rc);
01481         }
01482         case OBD_IOC_GETDTNAME:
01483         case OBD_IOC_GETMDNAME:
01484                 RETURN(ll_get_obd_name(inode, cmd, arg));
01485         case LL_IOC_FLUSHCTX:
01486                 RETURN(ll_flush_ctx(inode));
01487 #ifdef CONFIG_FS_POSIX_ACL
01488         case LL_IOC_RMTACL: {
01489             if (sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_RMT_CLIENT &&
01490                 inode == inode->i_sb->s_root->d_inode) {
01491                 struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
01492 
01493                 LASSERT(fd != NULL);
01494                 rc = rct_add(&sbi->ll_rct, current_pid(), arg);
01495                 if (!rc)
01496                         fd->fd_flags |= LL_FILE_RMTACL;
01497                 RETURN(rc);
01498             } else
01499                 RETURN(0);
01500         }
01501 #endif
01502         case LL_IOC_GETOBDCOUNT: {
01503                 u32 count, vallen;
01504                 struct obd_export *exp;
01505 
01506                 if (copy_from_user(&count, (int __user *)arg, sizeof(int)))
01507                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01508 
01509                 /* get ost count when count is zero, get mdt count otherwise */
01510                 exp = count ? sbi->ll_md_exp : sbi->ll_dt_exp;
01511                 vallen = sizeof(count);
01512                 rc = obd_get_info(NULL, exp, sizeof(KEY_TGT_COUNT),
01513                                   KEY_TGT_COUNT, &vallen, &count);
01514                 if (rc) {
01515                         CERROR("get target count failed: %d\n", rc);
01516                         RETURN(rc);
01517                 }
01518 
01519                 if (copy_to_user((int __user *)arg, &count, sizeof(int)))
01520                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01521 
01522                 RETURN(0);
01523         }
01524         case LL_IOC_PATH2FID:
01525                 if (copy_to_user((void __user *)arg, ll_inode2fid(inode),
01526                                      sizeof(struct lu_fid)))
01527                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01528                 RETURN(0);
01529         case LL_IOC_GET_CONNECT_FLAGS: {
01530                 RETURN(obd_iocontrol(cmd, sbi->ll_md_exp, 0, NULL,
01531                                      (void __user *)arg));
01532         }
01533         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_SEND:
01534         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_CLEAR:
01535                 if (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
01536                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01537 
01538                 rc = copy_and_ioctl(cmd, sbi->ll_md_exp, (void __user *)arg,
01539                                     sizeof(struct ioc_changelog));
01540                 RETURN(rc);
01541         case OBD_IOC_FID2PATH:
01542                 RETURN(ll_fid2path(inode, (void __user *)arg));
01543         case LL_IOC_GETPARENT:
01544                 RETURN(ll_getparent(file, (void __user *)arg));
01545         case LL_IOC_FID2MDTIDX: {
01546                 struct obd_export *exp = ll_i2mdexp(inode);
01547                 struct lu_fid     fid;
01548                 __u32             index;
01549 
01550                 if (copy_from_user(&fid, (const struct lu_fid __user *)arg,
01551                                    sizeof(fid)))
01552                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01553 
01554                 /* Call mdc_iocontrol */
01555                 rc = obd_iocontrol(LL_IOC_FID2MDTIDX, exp, sizeof(fid), &fid,
01556                                    (__u32 __user *)&index);
01557                 if (rc != 0)
01558                         RETURN(rc);
01559 
01560                 RETURN(index);
01561         }
01562         case LL_IOC_HSM_REQUEST: {
01563                 struct hsm_user_request *hur;
01564                 ssize_t                  totalsize;
01565 
01566                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(hur);
01567                 if (hur == NULL)
01568                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01569 
01570                 /* We don't know the true size yet; copy the fixed-size part */
01571                 if (copy_from_user(hur, (void __user *)arg, sizeof(*hur))) {
01572                         OBD_FREE_PTR(hur);
01573                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01574                 }
01575 
01576                 /* Compute the whole struct size */
01577                 totalsize = hur_len(hur);
01578                 OBD_FREE_PTR(hur);
01579                 if (totalsize < 0)
01580                         RETURN(-E2BIG);
01581 
01582                 /* Final size will be more than double totalsize */
01583                 if (totalsize >= MDS_MAXREQSIZE / 3)
01584                         RETURN(-E2BIG);
01585 
01586                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(hur, totalsize);
01587                 if (hur == NULL)
01588                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01589 
01590                 /* Copy the whole struct */
01591                 if (copy_from_user(hur, (void __user *)arg, totalsize))
01592                         GOTO(out_hur, rc = -EFAULT);
01593 
01594                 if (hur->hur_request.hr_action == HUA_RELEASE) {
01595                         const struct lu_fid *fid;
01596                         struct inode *f;
01597                         int i;
01598 
01599                         for (i = 0; i < hur->hur_request.hr_itemcount; i++) {
01600                                 fid = &hur->hur_user_item[i].hui_fid;
01601                                 f = search_inode_for_lustre(inode->i_sb, fid);
01602                                 if (IS_ERR(f)) {
01603                                         rc = PTR_ERR(f);
01604                                         break;
01605                                 }
01606 
01607                                 rc = ll_hsm_release(f);
01608                                 iput(f);
01609                                 if (rc != 0)
01610                                         break;
01611                         }
01612                 } else {
01613                         rc = obd_iocontrol(cmd, ll_i2mdexp(inode), totalsize,
01614                                            hur, NULL);
01615                 }
01616 
01617 out_hur:
01618                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(hur, totalsize);
01619 
01620                 RETURN(rc);
01621         }
01622         case LL_IOC_HSM_PROGRESS: {
01623                 struct hsm_progress_kernel      hpk;
01624                 struct hsm_progress             hp;
01625 
01626                 if (copy_from_user(&hp, (void __user *)arg, sizeof(hp)))
01627                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01628 
01629                 hpk.hpk_fid = hp.hp_fid;
01630                 hpk.hpk_cookie = hp.hp_cookie;
01631                 hpk.hpk_extent = hp.hp_extent;
01632                 hpk.hpk_flags = hp.hp_flags;
01633                 hpk.hpk_errval = hp.hp_errval;
01634                 hpk.hpk_data_version = 0;
01635 
01636                 /* File may not exist in Lustre; all progress
01637                  * reported to Lustre root */
01638                 rc = obd_iocontrol(cmd, sbi->ll_md_exp, sizeof(hpk), &hpk,
01639                                    NULL);
01640                 RETURN(rc);
01641         }
01642         case LL_IOC_HSM_CT_START:
01643                 if (!cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
01644                         RETURN(-EPERM);
01645 
01646                 rc = copy_and_ioctl(cmd, sbi->ll_md_exp, (void __user *)arg,
01647                                     sizeof(struct lustre_kernelcomm));
01648                 RETURN(rc);
01649 
01650         case LL_IOC_HSM_COPY_START: {
01651                 struct hsm_copy *copy;
01652                 int              rc;
01653 
01654                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(copy);
01655                 if (copy == NULL)
01656                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01657                 if (copy_from_user(copy, (char __user *)arg, sizeof(*copy))) {
01658                         OBD_FREE_PTR(copy);
01659                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01660                 }
01661 
01662                 rc = ll_ioc_copy_start(inode->i_sb, copy);
01663                 if (copy_to_user((char __user *)arg, copy, sizeof(*copy)))
01664                         rc = -EFAULT;
01665 
01666                 OBD_FREE_PTR(copy);
01667                 RETURN(rc);
01668         }
01669         case LL_IOC_HSM_COPY_END: {
01670                 struct hsm_copy *copy;
01671                 int              rc;
01672 
01673                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(copy);
01674                 if (copy == NULL)
01675                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01676                 if (copy_from_user(copy, (char __user *)arg, sizeof(*copy))) {
01677                         OBD_FREE_PTR(copy);
01678                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01679                 }
01680 
01681                 rc = ll_ioc_copy_end(inode->i_sb, copy);
01682                 if (copy_to_user((char __user *)arg, copy, sizeof(*copy)))
01683                         rc = -EFAULT;
01684 
01685                 OBD_FREE_PTR(copy);
01686                 RETURN(rc);
01687         }
01688         case LL_IOC_MIGRATE: {
01689                 char            *buf = NULL;
01690                 const char      *filename;
01691                 int             namelen = 0;
01692                 int             len;
01693                 int             rc;
01694                 int             mdtidx;
01695 
01696                 rc = obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, (void __user *)arg);
01697                 if (rc < 0)
01698                         RETURN(rc);
01699 
01700                 data = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)buf;
01701                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL || data->ioc_inlbuf2 == NULL ||
01702                     data->ioc_inllen1 == 0 || data->ioc_inllen2 == 0)
01703                         GOTO(migrate_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01704 
01705                 filename = data->ioc_inlbuf1;
01706                 namelen = data->ioc_inllen1;
01707                 /* \0 is packed at the end of filename */
01708                 if (namelen < 1 || namelen != strlen(filename) + 1)
01709                         GOTO(migrate_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01710 
01711                 if (data->ioc_inllen2 != sizeof(mdtidx))
01712                         GOTO(migrate_free, rc = -EINVAL);
01713                 mdtidx = *(int *)data->ioc_inlbuf2;
01714 
01715                 rc = ll_migrate(inode, file, mdtidx, filename, namelen - 1);
01716 migrate_free:
01717                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01718 
01719                 RETURN(rc);
01720         }
01721         default:
01722                 RETURN(obd_iocontrol(cmd, sbi->ll_dt_exp, 0, NULL,
01723                                      (void __user *)arg));
01724         }
01725 }
01726 
01727 static loff_t ll_dir_seek(struct file *file, loff_t offset, int origin)
01728 {
01729         struct inode *inode = file->f_mapping->host;
01730         struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
01731         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01732         int api32 = ll_need_32bit_api(sbi);
01733         loff_t ret = -EINVAL;
01734         ENTRY;
01735 
01736         mutex_lock(&inode->i_mutex);
01737         switch (origin) {
01738                 case SEEK_SET:
01739                         break;
01740                 case SEEK_CUR:
01741                         offset += file->f_pos;
01742                         break;
01743                 case SEEK_END:
01744                         if (offset > 0)
01745                                 GOTO(out, ret);
01746                         if (api32)
01747                                 offset += LL_DIR_END_OFF_32BIT;
01748                         else
01749                                 offset += LL_DIR_END_OFF;
01750                         break;
01751                 default:
01752                         GOTO(out, ret);
01753         }
01754 
01755         if (offset >= 0 &&
01756             ((api32 && offset <= LL_DIR_END_OFF_32BIT) ||
01757              (!api32 && offset <= LL_DIR_END_OFF))) {
01758                 if (offset != file->f_pos) {
01759                         if ((api32 && offset == LL_DIR_END_OFF_32BIT) ||
01760                             (!api32 && offset == LL_DIR_END_OFF))
01761                                 fd->lfd_pos = MDS_DIR_END_OFF;
01762                         else if (api32 && sbi->ll_flags & LL_SBI_64BIT_HASH)
01763                                 fd->lfd_pos = offset << 32;
01764                         else
01765                                 fd->lfd_pos = offset;
01766                         file->f_pos = offset;
01767                         file->f_version = 0;
01768                 }
01769                 ret = offset;
01770         }
01771         GOTO(out, ret);
01772 
01773 out:
01774         mutex_unlock(&inode->i_mutex);
01775         return ret;
01776 }
01777 
01778 static int ll_dir_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01779 {
01780         ENTRY;
01781         RETURN(ll_file_open(inode, file));
01782 }
01783 
01784 static int ll_dir_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01785 {
01786         ENTRY;
01787         RETURN(ll_file_release(inode, file));
01788 }
01789 
01790 const struct file_operations ll_dir_operations = {
01791         .llseek         = ll_dir_seek,
01792         .open           = ll_dir_open,
01793         .release        = ll_dir_release,
01794         .read           = generic_read_dir,
01795 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
01796         .iterate        = ll_iterate,
01797 #else
01798         .readdir        = ll_readdir,
01799 #endif
01800         .unlocked_ioctl = ll_dir_ioctl,
01801         .fsync          = ll_fsync,
01802 };
